snippet: If enough people are determined, they can destroy ancient and seemingly permanent legal, political, educational and religious institutions that are essential to civil society.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Washington Post columnist Anne Applebaum draws on lessons learned from aftermath of Eastern European dictatorships to shed light on ways in which Middle Eastern countries can recover from autocratic regimes; notes that key to reinvigorating repressed society is establishment of institutions that are essential to civil society.
lead_paragraph: If enough people are determined, they can destroy ancient and seemingly permanent legal, political, educational and religious institutions that are essential to civil society.

headline.seo: The Dead Weight of Past Dictatorships
headline.main: After Tyrants, the People Must Act
headline.print_headline: After Tyrants, The People Must Act

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
